The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

div.head: The Sincere MILK of the Word, FOR THE Children Of Barmuda.
IN A Short and Plain CATECHISM.
div.byline: By Mr. Sampſon Bond, late Miniſter on that Iſland.

q.p: Come ye Children, Hearken unto me, I will teach you the Fear of the Lord.

p.label: Que.
p.hi: WHat is GOD?

div.p: Anſw.GOD is a Spi ••• having his Being of Himſelf.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Properties of Go • Being?

div.p: A.Infinite,Iſa. 6.3. Rom. 16 27. Pſal. 14.5.3 Math. 19 17. Deut 6 4 1 Cor. 8 4 6. Mat. 28.19 1 John 5.7. Gen. 1.1 Coloſ. 1.16 John 1.3. Pſal 36.6 Mat. 10 29.30 Acts 17.25, 28. Pſal. 4.6 Pſal. 73.25. John 17.21, 22 Gen 2.7 Gen 1. Holineſs, Power, Wiſdom and Goodneſs.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How many Gods be there?

div.p: AThere is but One true God, in three Perſons: the Father, Son and Holy Ghoſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How had man and all other Creatures their Being?

div.p: A.By the power of God they were all created and m • de.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How are they all preſerved & kept?

div.p: A.By the Providence of God in whom all live, move & have their Being.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Wherein doth man's true Bleſſedneſs conſiſt?

div.p:
A.Not in worldly pleaſures, prof or honours; but in Serving and E •
joying this God for Ever.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Who was the firſt man God made

div.p: A.Adam was firſt formed by Go • of the Duſt of the Ground.

p.label: Q
p.hi: In what Eſtate did God create man?

div.p: AGod created man in his own Image.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Wherein doth the Image of God conſist?

div.p: AIn Knowledge, Righteouſneſs 〈◊〉 true Holineſs.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Did man continue in that Eſtate?

div.p:
ANo, he fell from that Eſtate b •
tranſgreſſing Gods Law.Eccleſ 7 29 Gen. 3.6.

p.label: Q
p.hi: How did Adam tranſgreſs Gods Law?

div.p: ABy eating the forbidden fruit.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Did all mankind ſin in Adam?

div.p: AIn Adam all ſinned; he being the Root of all mankind.

p.label: Q
p.hi: What Puniſhment is due for mans Sin?

div.p: AAll temporal & eternal miſeries.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Is there no way for man to eſcape this Puniſhment?

div.p: AYes, For God ſo loved the world that he gave his onely Begotten Son, that whoſoever. Believeth in him, ſhould not periſh, b • t have everlaſting Life.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Who is that onely Begotten Son of God?

div.p: AJeſus Chriſt who was born of the Virgin Mary. Math 1 18. Luk 1.35

p.label: Q
p.hi: What manner of Perſon was Jeſus Christ?

div.p: AHe was God and Man,Rom. 9.5 1 Tim 3.16 both in one Perſon.

p.label: Q
p.hi: How came Chriſt to be mans Saviour?

div.p: ABy taking on him man's nature,Heb. 2 16 Gal. 3.13 and being made a curſe for us, that he might redeem us from the curſe of the Law.

p.label: Q
p.hi: How was Chriſt made a curſe for us?

div.p: ABy ſuffering the paines of Death in his Body,Math. 27 35, 36 Iſa 53.10 Math. 26 38 Heb 2 17 Acts 3.22 Pſal. 110. •… 2 Cor. 1 30 Heb • 9 1 Cor. 1 30 Luk 4.18 Pſal 110 1, 2 Acts 5.31. John 3.16.36 Acts 16.30, 31 being crucified; and enduring the wrath of God on his Soul.

p.label: Q
p.hi: How does Christ execute the Office of a Redeemer?

div.p: ABy being a Prophet, a Prieſt and a King over his Church.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Why was Chriſt a Prieſt?

div.p: ATo purchaſe Righteouſneſs and Life Eternal for his Church.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Why was Chriſt a Prophet?

div.p: ATo reveal the way to Life Eternal unto his Church.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Why was Chriſt a King?

div.p: AThat by his Power he might govern and preſerve his Church, unto the Poſſeſſion of Life Eternal.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Shall all mankind then be Saved?

div.p: ANo, onely ſuch as Believe on the Lord Jeſus ſhall be ſaved.

p.label: Q
p.hi: What is it to believe on the Lord Jeſus Christ?

div.p: ATo receive Jeſus Chriſt for our Lord and Saviour,Joh 1.12 Eph 1 12 Pſal 2.12 truſting onely to him for Salvation.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Is it in mans power to believe?

div.p: A.No;Eph 1.19 FAITH is the Gift of God.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is Faith obtained?

div.p: A.Faith comes by hearing the Word of God.Rom. 10 17

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Word of God?

div.p: A.The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Teſtament.2 Tim 3.16 2 Pet. 1.19, 20 21 Rom 1 16 2 Tim 3.15 1 Cor. 2 12, 14. Iſa 54.13 Ezek 3 • 27. Pſal 1 18, 27 36 Mark 1 15 Ac •• 5.31.17.30 2 Cor • 11 T ••… 2.12 Heb. •… Gal. 3. •…

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Is the Word alone ſufficient to beget Faith?

div.p: A.No; not without the inward workings of the Spirit.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are thoſe workings of the Spirit?

div.p: A.The Spirit inwardly teacheth us to know the truth, and inclines us to embrace and believe the ſame.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Is nothing elſe required to Salvation but Faith?

div.p: A.Saving Faith is always accompanied with true Repentance.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is true Repentance?

div.p: A.A Godly Sorrow for Sin, with an hatred of it, endeavouring to walk ſoberly, righteouſly and godly in all the ways of New Obedience.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Rule of our New Obedience?

div.p: A.The perfect Law of God contained in the Ten Commandments.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Where are thoſe Commandments laid down?

div.p: A.In the Twentieth Chapter of Exodus. Exod. 20

p.label: Q
p.hi: What is the Sum of the Ten Commandments?

div.p: A.To love the Lord our God with all our hearts, with all our Souls, with all our ſtrength,Math 22 37, 38 Luk 10 27 with all our mind; and our Neighbour as our ſelves.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Is any man able perfectly to keep the Commandments?

div.p: A.No;Eccle. 7.29 Gen. 6.5 1 John 1 8.10 Pſal. 119. • 6, 10 • at. 5.6. We all break them daily in thought, word, and deed.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who then ſhall be ſaved?

div.p: A.Such as believing in Chriſt, daily repent of their ſin, and endeavour with their whole hearts to keep the Commandments.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What means must be uſed for getting and encreaſing grace to keep the Commandments?

div.p: A.We muſt Diligently attend upon God in his Ordinances.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What Ordinances are thoſe?

div.p: A.The Word, Sacraments and Prayer.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What Diligence is required about the Word?

div.p: A.Diligent hearing, reading and meditating of the ſame.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Sacraments?

div.p:
A.They are outward Signs, where
• y Chriſt and his Benefits are ſignified and ſealed.Gen. 17.7.10 Rom 4.11

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How many are there?

div.p: A.Two, Baptiſm and the Lords Supper.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the outward Sign of Baptiſm?

div.p: A.Waſhing with Water, in the Name of the Father, Son,Mat. 28 19. and Holy Ghoſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the thing ſignified?

div.p: A.Remiſſion of Sins by Chriſts Blood,Mat. 1.21. Acts. 2: 3 8. Eph 5.26 and Sanctification by his Spirit.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Outward Signs of • he Lords Supper?

div.p: A.Bread and Wine, which being Broken, Given and Poured forth;Math. 26 26, 27. 1 Cor. 11 24 1 Cor. 10 16 1 Cor. 11 24. Phil 4 6 Joh. 16 26 1 Joh. 1.9 Mat. 16 9, 10, 11, 12, 13. the Believer muſt take, eat and drink.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What do theſe ſignifie?

div.p:
A.The Body and Blood of Chriſt, or the ſpiritual growth and nouriſh
• ent of Believers.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Prayer?

div.p: A.Prayer is the making known of 〈◊〉 Requeſts to God in the Name of •••… iſt, with confeſſion of our ſins, 〈◊〉 . Thanksgiving for his mercies.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What pattern have we to pray by?

div.p:
A.The Lord's Prayer Contained
in the VIth of Matthew, IX, X, XI, XII, and XIIIth. Verſes.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Shall men dye?

div.p: A.It is appointed to all men once to dye.Heb. 9.27

p.label: Q
p.hi: What follows Death?

div.p: A.After Death comes Judgment.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: By whom ſhall men be Judged?

div.p: A.We muſt all appear before the Judgment Seat of Chriſt.2 Cor 5 10. Acts 10 42 Acts. 24 15. John 5.28, 29. Acts 17.31. 2 Cor. 5 10 Math. 25 46 Mark 9 43, 44

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How can the Dead be Judged?

div.p: A.There ſhall be a Reſurrection of the Dead, both of the Juſt and Unjuſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How will Chriſt Judge men?

div.p: A.In Righteouſneſs according to their Deeds.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What ſhall be the Judgment of the Wicked?

div.p: A.The Wicked ſhall be puniſhed with Everlaſting Fire.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What ſhall become of the Righteous?

div.p: A.The Righteous ſhall enter in •• Life Eternal.Mat. 25 34, 46
